abstract: Beijing has allowed remarkable transparency in the coverage of the bird flu outbreak. Living in Beijing, I have to hope the transparency is real, the author writes.
snippet: Beijing has allowed remarkable transparency in the coverage of the bird flu outbreak. Living in Beijing, I have to hope the transparency is real, the author writes.
lead_paragraph: China has now confirmed 28 cases of infection with the bird flu virus H7N9. Eight people have died. The government has learned many lessons from the SARS outbreak in 2003 and subsequent cover-up, and so far the World Health Organization has publicly praised China’s handling of this new flu variant.

headline.main: Bird Flu Concerns and North Korean Jitters
